summary: This bill, the Washington, D.C. Admission Act, proposes to admit the State of Washington, Douglass Commonwealth into the Union. It outlines procedures for elections, boundaries of the remaining seat of the U.S. government (the Capital), and provisions for federal property, courts, and elections. It also addresses the continuation of various authorities and responsibilities, including employee benefits, agencies like the Public Defender Service, and other programs, while establishing a Statehood Transition Commission. The bill aims to provide for a smooth transition to statehood, including outlining the powers, duties and responsibilities of the new state.
